sentences: Carlton Neron Thomas (born June 15, 1972) is an American R&B singer.
One such performance caught the eye of Sean "Puffy" Combs, who signed Thomas to Bad Boy Entertainment in 1997.
With the single "I Wish" released in late 1999, topping the R&B charts for six consecutive weeks, creating strong interest.
Emotional, his debut album was released on April 18, 2000.

On the strength of this single, and the album's other singles, "Summer Rain" at No. 18, which also appeared on the soundtrack to the 2000 film version of Shaft, and the title track "Emotional" at No. 8 on the R&B charts, the album was certified platinum with over 1 million in sales.
"I Wish" on his 2000 album The Dynasty: Roc La Familia.
His second album, Let's Talk About It, was released on March 23, 2004.
In 2005, Thomas was featured on R&B singer Amerie's second album Touch, on the ninth track, entitled "Can We Go".

On December 7, 2006, Thomas earned a Grammy Award nomination, along with Chaka Khan, Yolanda Adams, and the late Gerald Levert, for "Everyday (Family Reunion)", a song from the soundtrack of Tyler Perry's Madea's Family Reunion.
His third album, So Much Better, was released May 30, 2007, and reached number 25 on the US Billboard 200.
Thomas' last album entitled Conquer was released on December 6, 2011.
In 2004, Thomas' brother was killed in a drive-by shooting shortly before Let's Talk About It came out.
In 2019, Thomas underwent a surgical procedure to remove a noncancerous tumor in his salivary glands.
On the 2006 2Pac album Pac's Life, he was featured beside Hussein Fatal and Papoose on the track "Dumpin'".
He branched out, however, and traveled to New York City, where he sang at clubs during open-mic nights.
With the single "I Wish" released in late 1999, topping the R&B charts for six consecutive weeks, creating strong interest.

On the strength of this single, and the album's other singles, "Summer Rain" at No. 18, which also appeared on the soundtrack to the 2000 film version of Shaft, and the title track "Emotional" at No. 8 on the R&B charts, the album was certified platinum with over 1 million in sales.
Lack of promotion caused by the death of Thomas's brother Duranthony Evans, who was killed in a drive-by on Halloween night on Aurora's east side was a contributing factor.
